context_of_use: This use case allows a manager to review and approve customer orders within the order management system.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: Allows a manager to review and approve customer orders to avoid delays in business processes.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending customer orders to be approved.
postconditions: The selected customer orders are approved.
The order status is updated to reflect approval.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display pending orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve customer orders.
The system shall update the order status upon approval.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval.
main_flow: 1. Manager selects pending orders → System displays the list of pending orders.
2. Manager reviews order details → System presents detailed information for the selected order.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to approved.
